== Introduction ==

These release notes for '''Kubuntu 16.10''' (Yakkety Yak) provide an overview of the release and document the known issues with '''Kubuntu 16.10'''.

=== Support lifespan ===

Kubuntu 16.10 will be supported for 9 months.

== Designed to be a Breeze, Plasma 5 is now even further improved ==

'''Plasma 5''', the next generation of KDE's desktop has been refined to make it smoother to use while retaining the familiar setup.  

The <nowiki>[[https://www.kde.org/announcements/plasma-5.7.5.php|7th set of updates to Plasma 5 (latest and final bugfix release from  September)]]</nowiki> is the default in this version of Kubuntu.

Combined with <nowiki>[[https://www.kde.org/announcements/kde-frameworks-5.26.0.php|KDE Frameworks 5.26.0]]</nowiki> the Plasma 5.7 desktop brings improved workflows, rewritten and improved task manager and system tray, another milestone step towards Wayland support, and improved Breeze icons and Plasma theme.

== KDE Applications 16.04.3 ==

Kubuntu comes with <nowiki>[[https://www.kde.org/announcements/announce-applications-16.04.3.php|KDE Applications 16.04.3]]</nowiki> containing all your favourite apps from KDE, including Dolphin. 

Even more applications have been ported to KDE Frameworks 5, but those which aren't should fit in seamlessly.

Non-KDE applications include <nowiki>[[https://wiki.documentfoundation.org/ReleaseNotes/5.2|LibreOffice 5.2]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/49.0/releasenotes/|Firefox 49]]</nowiki>.

== Getting Kubuntu 16.10 ==

|-

| '''Download a Disk Image'''
|-
| <<BR>> To upgrade to Kubuntu 16.10 from 16.04: <<BR>>  - Open '''Discover''' or '''Muon Package Manager''' <<BR>>  - Ensure that your current system is up to date by installing available updates <<BR>> - Open Configure Software Sources from the settings menu. Depending on your version of Discover, this may be found in the 'advanced' sub-menu. <<BR>> - Select the 'Updates' tab, and in the 'Release upgrade' section select '''Normal Releases'''. <<BR>> - Kubuntu 16.10 should then be made available by your normal release upgrade method. <<BR>> - An example method would be to search for and run 'update-manager' from the K menu or Krunner <<BR>> <<BR>> '''Note:''' If the distribution upgrade process fails to launch, you may need to install the package '''ubuntu-release-upgrader-qt'''. See the known issues section below. <<BR>> <<BR>>If you want to upgrade from console, open ''/etc/update-manager/release-upgrades'' file as root and change ''Prompt'' line to ''normal'' (from lts). Then run ''do-release-upgrade'' in console.
| - Download a <nowiki>[[http://cdimage.ubuntu.com/kubuntu/releases/yakkety/release/|Bootable image]]</nowiki>. Direct downloads, torrents, and zysnc are available as options. <<BR>> - The following link contains some tips to put the image onto a <nowiki>[[ http:--docs.kubuntu.org-docs-installation.html | DVD or USB Drive ]]</nowiki>
|}

== Known Problems ==

* (Bug:1633692) upgrade from 16.04 to 16.10 may require a user to manually install the package '''ubuntu-release-upgrader-qt''' prior to running the upgrade
* (Bug:1514491) kubuntu desktop inconsistency and integration issues: scrollbars. gtk3 button placement also not integrated
* (Bug:1530523) kcm_driver_manager: Infinitely shows Collecting information
* (Bug:1561051) Ubiquity-DM dies on Kubuntu images

Please also take note of the <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/YakketyYak/ReleaseNotes|Ubuntu Release Notes]]</nowiki>, that might contain additional information.
